summary: SURIGAO CITY, Surigao del Norte — A massive fire tore through residential areas along Nueva Street and P. According to the Bureau of Fire Protection (BFP), the fire started at 4:31 p.m. and was declared under control at 7:29 p.m. Initial assessments show that 139 families, or 519 individuals, lost their homes. The affected residents were mainly from Purok Camia and Purok Diamond, two densely populated areas. title: AFP, PNP, PCG conclude first joint drills on ‘co-equal’ operations
summary: MANILA, Philippines — The Armed Forces of the Philippines (AFP), the Philippine National Police (PNP) and the Philippine Coast Guard (PCG) on Wednesday concluded their first interagency tabletop exercise. AFP chief of staff Gen. Romeo Brawner Jr. said the exercise was a pilot run that marks a shift in how the country’s security forces train and operate together. Unlike previous joint activities where one agency typically took the lead, the inaugural Interagency Exercise (IAX) placed the AFP, PNP and PCG on “co-equal footing,” an approach Brawner said is now necessary as the Philippines confronts overlapping internal, maritime and multidomain threats. title: Coast guard seizes P8-M smuggled cigarettes in Sulu waters

Authorities reported that upon boarding and inspection, the team found that the vessel and its cargo were operating without the required documents and were not displaying the markings mandated under the government’s Safety, Security, and Environmental Numbering System. In an advisory issued Sunday evening, Senate Secretary Renato Bantug said the session hall sustained water seepage due to suppression measures used to contain the fire, which specifically affected the office of the Legislative Technical Affairs Bureau on the third floor of the upper chamber. READ: Fire breaks out at Senate building in Pasay City Bantug said that, per Sotto’s instruction, the 30th session of the Senate will be […]... Keep on reading: Senate suspends session on Dec. 1 after Sunday's fire

title: POCO unveils its 2025 flagship phone, the F8 Pro with highly anticipated features
summary: POCO has officially launched its most powerful flagship phone to date, the POCO F8 Pro, in a November 26 global launch event. The F8 pro is an upper mid-range smartphone powered by HyperOS 3, Xiaomi’s in-house chip optimized for a smooth user experience. It runs on Android 16 paired with the Snapdragon 8 Elite and Adreno 830 GPU, one of the most advanced and high-end mobile processors in the market. The F8 Pro also prides itself with an extensive storage featuring 16GB of RAM and up to 1TB internal storage. Its 6.9” wide screen delivers an immersive viewing experience, while […]... title: Solar energy protects German vineyards from climate change
summary: “VitiVoltaic” projects aim to make viticulture fit for climate change. The term is a portmanteau of the Latin genus name for the grapevine, vitis vinifera, and the word for solar power generation, photovoltaics. This new technology makes it possible to harvest two very different things on two levels: Electricity above and wine grapes below. Pilot projects are underway to test which technology works where — and at what price. In Germany’s southwestern Rheingau region, known for its picturesque vineyards, the Hochschule Geisenheim University (HGU) specializes in all aspects of the wine industry. title: Russia's disinformation campaign in Armenia gains momentum
summary: A rise in disinformation is targeting Prime Minister Nikol Pashinyan and his government in the run-up to the Armenian parliamentary election next June, say experts. title: Warmer seas causing Japan's oysters to die 'en masse': officials
summary: TOKYO, Japan — Oysters in Japan are dying en masse in parts of the country’s top production area, likely due to warmer sea temperatures, officials said Monday, December 1. In some coastal areas surrounding the Seto Inland Sea in western Japan, an area that accounts for more than three quarters of Japan’s farmed oyster production, around 90 percent of cultivated oysters are dead. “I’ve never experienced this in my whole career,” Tatsuya Morio, who has farmed oysters for more than 20 years, told Agence France Presse. title: HK grants financial aid to kin of domestic workers who perished in fire
summary: MANILA, Philippines–The surviving kin of foreign domestic helpers who died in last week’s massive fire that hit a high-rise residential compound in Tai Po district, including one Filipino, are set to receive around HK$800,000 (roughly P6 million) in compensation from the Hong Kong government. Hong Kong’s Labor and Welfare Secretary Chris Sun held a joint press conference on Tuesday afternoon with Department of Migrant Workers (DMW) Secretary Hans Cacdac to announce the various forms of assistance to be given to those affected by the Nov. 29 fire. title: Flood-hit Southeast Asia saw highest November rains since 2012: AFP analysis
summary: Some flood-hit regions of Southeast Asia experienced their heaviest November rains since 2012, according to an Agence France Presse (AFP) analysis, as climate change intensifies seasonal weather patterns. Large areas of Indonesia, the Philippines, Malaysia, Vietnam, Thailand, and Myanmar, as well as parts of Cambodia and Laos, recorded rainfall totals not seen in the month of November for more than a decade, according to monthly U.S. data from the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA). In recent weeks, more than 1,300 people have died during floods in Southeast Asia. Heavy rains are common during the monsoon season. Rainfall levels up […]... title: ICI urged to probe into Davao City flood control projects
summary: MANILA, Philippines — Deputy Minority Leader and Act Teachers party-list Rep. Antonio Tinio on Tuesday urged the Independent Commission for Infrastructure (ICI) to investigate flood control projects in Davao City from 2019 to 2022. title: 3 drug suspects busted in Cavite sting; P68-M shabu seized
summary: MANILA, Philippines — A buy-bust operation in Cavite led to the confiscation of P68 million worth of suspected shabu (crystal meth) and the arrest of three individuals, the Philippine Drug Enforcement Agency (PDEA) said on Tuesday. In a statement, PDEA said that the suspects, identified only as “Marie,” 41; “Michael,” 42; and “Mohammad,” 44, were caught with 10 kilograms of shabu in self-sealing plastic bags in an entrapment operation in Barangay Molino IV, Bacoor City Monday night. “The suspects were caught red-handed after selling 750 grams of shabu, to an undercover agent posing as a buyer,” the PDEA explained. summary: MANILA – Senator Bam Aquino has filed a measure seeking to overhaul the country’s party-list system to ensure it genuinely represents marginalized and underrepresented sectors, amid growing concerns that powerful political clans and corporations have captured the system. title: Phreatic, phreatomagmatic eruptions hit Taal Volcano
summary: LUCENA CITY — Taal Volcano in Batangas province generated two short-lived eruptions — one phreatic and one phreatomagmatic — early Thursday, December 4, the Philippine Institute of Volcanology and Seismology (Phivolcs) reported. Phivolcs said the phreatic burst occurred at 12:58 a.m., followed by a phreatomagmatic explosion six minutes later. Both lasted about two minutes. The activity produced plumes rising approximately 1,200 meters before drifting southwest, as seen through the volcano’s IP surveillance camera. During the phreatomagmatic event, incandescent fragments were expelled up to 300 meters above Taal Lake, Phivolcs added. title: Bogus ‘plunder’ narrative against Recto
summary: A plain truth must be said outright: the renewed chorus accusing Executive Secretary Ralph G. Recto of “plunder” and “technical malversation” over the P60-billion PhilHealth remittance is not grounded in fact. It is a muddle of confusion dressed up as outrage. The claims fall apart under three immovable facts. First: The Department of Finance (DOF) neither conceived nor redirected funds to flood-control projects. summary: MANILA, Philippines — The Philippine National Police – Highway Patrol Group (PNP-HPG) on Thursday reported recovering 326 stolen motor vehicles and 106 stolen motorcycles in operations conducted between August 26 and November 30, 2025. title: DepEd rolls out P131-M literacy boost for 131 priority schools
summary: MANILA, Philippines – Championing equity in education, the Department of Education (DepEd) has officially activated the Bayang Bumabasa Initiative, allotting P131 million in Needs-Based Program Support Funds to assist 131 priority schools in accelerating literacy gains. The initiative, unveiled during the 2025 National Literacy Conference, will provide up to P1 million per school to implement locally responsive and contextualized reading programs. The 131 recipient schools — including 25 located in geographically isolated and disadvantaged areas — were identified through the School Year (SY) 2024–2025 Comprehensive Rapid Literacy Assessment (CRLA) as priority areas for additional support. title: DepEd boosts ARAL, feeding programs as Angara visits Las Piñas schools
summary: MANILA, Philippines — The Department of Education (DepEd) on Friday underscored the Marcos administration’s intensified push for learning recovery as Education Secretary Sonny Angara inspected the rollout of the School-Based Feeding Program (SBFP) and the Academic Recovery and Accessible Learning (ARAL) initiative in two Las Piñas public schools. title: Thinness obsession prompts diet drug misuse in South Korea
summary: A wave of demand for weight-loss medication is sweeping South Korea, a country that remains one of the OECD’s leanest, as rising body-image pressure and easy access fuel misuse that concerns health authorities. Eli Lilly’s oral GLP-1 agonist orforglipron may launch in Korea next year once it receives approval from the US Food and Drug Administration, according to media reports on Sunday.
